headline.main: Kaiser Wilhelm's April 1 Gift.(2); HOTEL BARTHOLDI TO CLOSE. Guests Asked to Seek Other Quarters -- The Manager Reticent. EX-PRESIDENT HARRISON HERE. Accompanied by His Secretary and His Personal Friend, Mr. Ransdell.

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: NEW YORK. (MISCELLANY.) CHURCHES, EXCHANGES, HOTELS, REAL ESTATE, SOCIETIES

docs.lead_paragraph: FRIEDRICHSRUH, April 1. -- The birthday gift of Emperor William to Prince Bismarck, which was forwarded by mall from Naples, consisted of a small photograph of the Emperor and his family, upon which was inscribed in pencil: "First of April, 1896. Wilhelm, Imperator, Rex."

headline.main: HOFFMAN HOUSE BANKRUPT; EDWARD S. STOKES RECEIVER IN FORECLOSURE PROCEEDINGS. Business to be Continued by Order of Court, Pending the Suit by Farmers' Loan and Trust Company, as Trustee for Bondholders -- Default in the Payment of Interest Due in July -- Bonds for $425,000 Outstanding -- Other Obligations.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Hoffman House is bankrupt. Late yesterday afternoon Judge Truax of the Supreme Court placed all the property of The company which owns the hotel in the hands of Edward S. Stokes, the present manager, as receiver. Mr. Stokes was given full power to continue the business until the outcome of the proceedings which resulted in his appointment is determined.

headline.main: DE LOGEROT'S CREDITORS AGREE.; They Grant Him All the Time He Needs to Pay Their Claims.

docs.lead_paragraph: The creditors of the Hotel de Logerot, against which property, at Fifth Avenue and Eighteenth Street, a mechanic's lion for $8,692 has been filed by the Pierce Miller Engineering Company for piping for electric wires, boilers, and steam fittings, met at the hotel yesterday afternoon to consider what action should be taken in regard to the debts of the hotel.

THE FIFTH-AVENUE HOTEL.; Erection of a Fire-Proof Staircase Refitting of the Twenty-Third-StreetWing.

docs.abstract: New-York City; Fifth Avenue; Fireproof Staircase Built by Proprietors
